segment.source: Here's what you'll need to start customizing, testing, and deploying Windows on mobile devices.
segment.target: Here's what you'll need to start customizing, testing, and deploying Windows on mobile devices.

segment.source: Before you can get started on your Windows mobile development, make sure you meet these requirements:
segment.target: Before you can get started on your Windows mobile development, make sure you meet these requirements:

segment.source: You have access to the Microsoft Connect site where mobile partners can download the latest mobile OS kits and packages.
segment.target: You have access to the Microsoft Connect site where mobile partners can download the latest mobile OS kits and packages.

segment.source: If you don't have access or need more information, contact your Microsoft representative.
segment.target: If you don't have access or need more information, contact your Microsoft representative.

segment.source: A development workstation or technician computer
segment.target: A development workstation or technician computer

segment.source: This PC will run the tools needed during the development process.
segment.target: This PC will run the tools needed during the development process.

segment.source: The PC must be running one of the following operating systems:
segment.target: The PC must be running one of the following operating systems:

segment.source: You must install all Windows critical updates to avoid any issues when using the mobile kits.
segment.target: You must install all Windows critical updates to avoid any issues when using the mobile kits.

segment.source: Uninstall earlier versions of the tools and kits
segment.target: Uninstall earlier versions of the tools and kits

segment.source: If you are using a different version of the tools and kits other than the ones listed in the Pairing information section of the kit release notes, you first need to uninstall all of the programs associated with these components.
segment.target: If you are using a different version of the tools and kits other than the ones listed in the Pairing information section of the kit release notes, you first need to uninstall all of the programs associated with these components.

segment.source: Download the kits and OS packages
segment.target: Download the kits and OS packages

segment.source: Download the latest kits and tools for Windows 10 Mobile from the Microsoft Connect site.
segment.target: Download the latest kits and tools for Windows 10 Mobile from the Microsoft Connect site.

segment.source: See Contents of the mobile build to learn more about the contents of the MobileOS kit for different silicon architectures.
segment.target: See Contents of the mobile build to learn more about the contents of the MobileOS kit for different silicon architectures.

segment.source: This mobile device should represent all the mobile devices in a single model line; for example, the Contoso Windows Phone.
segment.target: This mobile device should represent all the mobile devices in a single model line; for example, the Contoso Windows Phone.

segment.source: For more information about detailed hardware requirements for any device that runs Windows 10 Mobile, see Section 2.0 - Minimum hardware requirements for Windows 10 Mobile in Minimum hardware requirements.
segment.target: For more information about detailed hardware requirements for any device that runs Windows 10 Mobile, see Section 2.0 - Minimum hardware requirements for Windows 10 Mobile in Minimum hardware requirements.

segment.source: Make sure you have all the necessary BSP files for your reference hardware.
segment.target: Make sure you have all the necessary BSP files for your reference hardware.

segment.source: A BSP is a set of files and drivers that Windows 10 Mobile uses to communicate with the hardware on the device, to launch the OS, and to create an OS image that can run on your reference hardware.
segment.target: A BSP is a set of files and drivers that Windows 10 Mobile uses to communicate with the hardware on the device, to launch the OS, and to create an OS image that can run on your reference hardware.

segment.source: The SoC vendor provides the BSP for your reference hardware.
segment.target: The SoC vendor provides the BSP for your reference hardware.

segment.source: Step 2: Install the tools and development kits
segment.target: Step 2: Install the tools and development kits

segment.source: The following kits and tools are used for Windows mobile development:
segment.target: The following kits and tools are used for Windows mobile development:

segment.source: Visual Studio 2015, which is your primary development environment for writing apps and drivers.
segment.target: Visual Studio 2015, which is your primary development environment for writing apps and drivers.

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile OS, which is contained in the MobileOS package.
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile OS, which is contained in the MobileOS package.

segment.source: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK), which contains the tools you can use for building and customizing your image as well as several other deployment tools that you can use to help you automate a large-scale deployment of Windows.
segment.target: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK), which contains the tools you can use for building and customizing your image as well as several other deployment tools that you can use to help you automate a large-scale deployment of Windows.

segment.source: Windows Driver Kit (WDK) and Windows 10 Standalone SDK, which you can install separately or install the Enterprise WDK (EWDK), which contains a version of the driver kit and SDK.
segment.target: Windows Driver Kit (WDK) and Windows 10 Standalone SDK, which you can install separately or install the Enterprise WDK (EWDK), which contains a version of the driver kit and SDK.

segment.source: Windows Hardware Lab Kit (HLK), which is a test framework you can use to test hardware devices for Windows.
segment.target: Windows Hardware Lab Kit (HLK), which is a test framework you can use to test hardware devices for Windows.

segment.source: The following table specifies which development scenarios require each of the kits and tools.
segment.target: The following table specifies which development scenarios require each of the kits and tools.

segment.source: Compile code that runs on the mobile device (for example, drivers, services, and apps)
segment.target: Compile code that runs on the mobile device (for example, drivers, services, and apps)

segment.source: Build and customize mobile images on the command line using ImgGen
segment.target: Build and customize mobile images on the command line using ImgGen

segment.source: Build and customize mobile images using Windows ICD
segment.target: Build and customize mobile images using Windows ICD

segment.source: To install the kits and tools
segment.target: To install the kits and tools

segment.source: Follow the instructions for downloading and installing Visual Studio 2015, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 10, and the Windows 10 SDK.
segment.target: Follow the instructions for downloading and installing Visual Studio 2015, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 10, and the Windows 10 SDK.

segment.source: Note Visual Studio 2015 is only required if you are compiling code that will run on the mobile device, such as drivers and apps.
segment.target: Note Visual Studio 2015 is only required if you are compiling code that will run on the mobile device, such as drivers and apps.

segment.source: To confirm that the Windows SDK was properly installed, make sure that the subdirectories listed in the following table exist on your technician PC.
segment.target: To confirm that the Windows SDK was properly installed, make sure that the subdirectories listed in the following table exist on your technician PC.

segment.source: Some of these subdirectories may not appear in the kit install directory if you didn't select them from the Windows SDK install wizard.
segment.target: Some of these subdirectories may not appear in the kit install directory if you didn't select them from the Windows SDK install wizard.

segment.source: For a 32-bit OS: C:\Program Files\Windows Kits\10
segment.target: For a 32-bit OS: C:\Program Files\Windows Kits\10

segment.source: For a 64-bit OS: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10
segment.target: For a 64-bit OS: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10

segment.source: To confirm that the WDK was properly installed, make sure that the subdirectories listed in the following table exist on your technician PC.
segment.target: To confirm that the WDK was properly installed, make sure that the subdirectories listed in the following table exist on your technician PC.

segment.source: For a 32-bit OS: C:\Program Files\Windows Kits\10
segment.target: For a 32-bit OS: C:\Program Files\Windows Kits\10

segment.source: For a 64-bit OS: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10
segment.target: For a 64-bit OS: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10

segment.source: Ensure that the Install Path is set to the kit install directory, C:Program FilesWindows Kits10 (for a 32-bit OS) or C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10 (for a 64-bit OS).
segment.target: Ensure that the Install Path is set to the kit install directory, C:Program FilesWindows Kits10 (for a 32-bit OS) or C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10 (for a 64-bit OS).

segment.source: In the Select the features you want to install page, select the following:
segment.target: In the Select the features you want to install page, select the following:

segment.source: To confirm that the Windows ADK was properly installed, make sure that the Assessment and Deployment Kit appears under your Windows installation directory.
segment.target: To confirm that the Windows ADK was properly installed, make sure that the Assessment and Deployment Kit appears under your Windows installation directory.

segment.source: Download the latest mobile OS kits and packages from the Microsoft Connect site and copy the contents to a local directory on your development workstation.
segment.target: Download the latest mobile OS kits and packages from the Microsoft Connect site and copy the contents to a local directory on your development workstation.

segment.source: The kits and packages contain the files and tools you need to build a Windows 10 Mobile image.
segment.target: The kits and packages contain the files and tools you need to build a Windows 10 Mobile image.

segment.source: Extract the packages and files to the kit install location.
segment.target: Extract the packages and files to the kit install location.

segment.source: Open the extracted package and copy all the subfolders and their contents to the kit install directory, C:Program FilesWindows Kits10 (for a 32-bit OS) or C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10 (for a 64-bit OS).
segment.target: Open the extracted package and copy all the subfolders and their contents to the kit install directory, C:Program FilesWindows Kits10 (for a 32-bit OS) or C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10 (for a 64-bit OS).

segment.source: The folders should be: FieldMedic, FMFiles, MSPackages, OEMCustomization, and OEMInputSamples.
segment.target: The folders should be: FieldMedic, FMFiles, MSPackages, OEMCustomization, and OEMInputSamples.

segment.source: In the OEM folder, double-click Setup.exe to install the following mobile components:
segment.target: In the OEM folder, double-click Setup.exe to install the following mobile components:

segment.source: Windows Hardware Lab Kit content for phone
segment.target: Windows Hardware Lab Kit content for phone

segment.source: You can install some tools separately from the mobile kit.
segment.target: You can install some tools separately from the mobile kit.

segment.source: These tools, which are contained in the IHVTools folder, are listed below.
segment.target: These tools, which are contained in the IHVTools folder, are listed below.

segment.source: The Windows phone common packaging and test tools.
segment.target: The Windows phone common packaging and test tools.

segment.source: The KDBG Connectivity package, which contains the following components:
segment.target: The KDBG Connectivity package, which contains the following components:

segment.source: Virtual network driver (the Virtual PC 2007 filter, VmNetSrv), which is required for the Virtual Ethernet tool unless Virtual PC 2007 is already installed; the user will be prompted to install two unsigned drivers.
segment.target: Virtual network driver (the Virtual PC 2007 filter, VmNetSrv), which is required for the Virtual Ethernet tool unless Virtual PC 2007 is already installed; the user will be prompted to install two unsigned drivers.

segment.source: USB debugger drivers (usb2dbg); the user will be prompted to install one signed driver.
segment.target: USB debugger drivers (usb2dbg); the user will be prompted to install one signed driver.

segment.source: The virtual network driver is installed in the %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Virtual PC\Utility\VMNetSrv (or %ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft Virtual PC\Utility\VMNetSrv for a 64-bit OS) directory.
segment.target: The virtual network driver is installed in the %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Virtual PC\Utility\VMNetSrv (or %ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft Virtual PC\Utility\VMNetSrv for a 64-bit OS) directory.

segment.source: The other three components are installed in the %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Windows Phone 8 KDBG Connectivity (or %ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft Windows Phone 8 KDBG Connectivity for a 64-bit OS) directory tree, with the virtual Ethernet tool in the bin subdirectory, the USB serial drivers in the drivers\Usb2Eth subdirectory, and the USB debugger drivers in the drivers\Usb2Dbg subdirectory.
segment.target: The other three components are installed in the %ProgramFiles%\Microsoft Windows Phone 8 KDBG Connectivity (or %ProgramFiles(x86)%\Microsoft Windows Phone 8 KDBG Connectivity for a 64-bit OS) directory tree, with the virtual Ethernet tool in the bin subdirectory, the USB serial drivers in the drivers\Usb2Eth subdirectory, and the USB debugger drivers in the drivers\Usb2Dbg subdirectory.

segment.source: The Test Shell, which is a set of command-line tools for use in the bring-up and testing of a mobile device.
segment.target: The Test Shell, which is a set of command-line tools for use in the bring-up and testing of a mobile device.

segment.source: You can use TShell for tasks such as copying files to the mobile device and to view logs.
segment.target: You can use TShell for tasks such as copying files to the mobile device and to view logs.

segment.source: Follow the steps below to set up the environment variables that are required for a working build environment.
segment.target: Follow the steps below to set up the environment variables that are required for a working build environment.

segment.source: To set up a build environment in Visual Studio 2015
segment.target: To set up a build environment in Visual Studio 2015

segment.source: Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS2015 window.
segment.target: Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS2015 window.

segment.source: Set the WPDKCONTENTROOT environment variable to the location of the Windows 10 Mobile kit installation directory.
segment.target: Set the WPDKCONTENTROOT environment variable to the location of the Windows 10 Mobile kit installation directory.

segment.source: For computers running a 32-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles%Windows Kits10.
segment.target: For computers running a 32-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles%Windows Kits10.

segment.source: For computers running a 64-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles(x86)%Windows Kits10.
segment.target: For computers running a 64-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles(x86)%Windows Kits10.

segment.source: Set the WDKCONTENTROOT environment variable to the location of the WDK kit installation directory.
segment.target: Set the WDKCONTENTROOT environment variable to the location of the WDK kit installation directory.

segment.source: For computers running a 32-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles%Windows Kits10.
segment.target: For computers running a 32-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles%Windows Kits10.

segment.source: For computers running a 64-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles(x86)%Windows Kits10.
segment.target: For computers running a 64-bit version of Windows, by default this is %ProgramFiles(x86)%Windows Kits10.

segment.source: Add the x86 tools directory for the Windows kits and the Windows kit tools directory to the PATH environment variable.
segment.target: Add the x86 tools directory for the Windows kits and the Windows kit tools directory to the PATH environment variable.

segment.source: To sign binaries and packages, you must install the OEM test certificates.
segment.target: To sign binaries and packages, you must install the OEM test certificates.

segment.source: After ensuring that WPDKCONTENTROOT is set to the path of the kit install location, run InstallOEMCerts.cmd by using the following command:
segment.target: After ensuring that WPDKCONTENTROOT is set to the path of the kit install location, run InstallOEMCerts.cmd by using the following command:

segment.source: For more information, see Set up the signing environment.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up the signing environment.
